result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. Jr was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. Jr was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. Jr was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with Atty Melissa Anne Frost.     
Court advises parties that this is the #3 case for Trial on September 18th.  
Court will set this for a further FPT on Sept. 14th at 2:30 pm.  
If the 2 other cases settle, then Mr. Hogan's case will proceed to trial as scheduled.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Original Order to Produce filed with Court.
DA Service Fees Invoice #17-538                  $160.00
Original filed with court.
DA Service Fees Invoice #583486            $75.00

3:34 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Raymond E. Hogan, Jr. in court, in custody, with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
This case is scheduled for a jury trial next week and is on today for a final pre-trial  Court explains that this case is being bumped by another trial proceeding on Monday.  Court advises that this will be reset.  There has been a document filed with the Court by Atty Frost entitled "Stipulated Facts".  It has not been signed by anyone but Attorney Frost acknowledges it was prepared by her.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Hogan about the stipulated facts.  Mr. Hogan is agreeing that the State does not have to have a witness from the crime lab here for trial to testify as to the controlled substances.  Atty Frost clarifies that there are 2 different potential witnesses from the crime lab - one would be testifying as to the DNA evidence and the defense is not stipulating to that evidence.  Court schedules new FPT and JT dates on case 2016CF000028.  Defendant's probation has been revoked in file 2012CF000341.  The Court will schedule that case for a sentencing after revocation hearing.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 08:30 am (3 days)

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 3-12-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

2:16 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.   
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Raymond E. Hogan appears by video from Redgranite Correctional, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  
Court notes that the parties had agreed that Mr. Hogan could appear by video for this hearing due to circumstances outlined at the prior hearing.  
2:17 pm  Argument by Atty Herrmann. Matter is before the Court on the State's Motion to file an Amended Information.  
2:18 pm  Response by Atty Frost questioning how this became "party to a crime"?  
2:21 pm  Response by Atty Herrmann.  
2:22 pm  Court makes record.  Court sees no prejudice to the defendant's rights.  Court will grant the State's motion and allow the Amended Information to be filed.  
2:24 pm  The State will e-file the Amended Information.  Defendant will be transported here for next week's Final Pre-trial.  
2:26 pm  Atty Frost advises that the parties will have one stipulated fact.  Atty Frost will file it by noon on Wednesday. 
2:27 pm  Court in recess.

TRANSCRIPT FILED on March 12, 2018 Court Reporter Linda Matoska
Document: Proposed Order - Order to Transport Incarcerated Witness Filed by: Melissa Anne Frost Reason: hard copy already signed per attorney request
Orig Trans Order sent over to S.O. 04/05/2017

2:33 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Melissa Anne Frost appeared.  This case was scheduled for sentencing after revocation hearing today.  Mr. Hogan is not present and is incarcerated at Red Granite.  There was a mistake made and Mr. Hogan was not produced via Writ.  Court has had discussions off the record with the Attorneys, and it has been decided that the SEHR (2012CF000341) will continue to track the defendant's pending case (2016CF000028) which is currently scheduled for a final pre-trial and jury trial.  The Court will set a hearing on the State's Motion to Amend the Information for April 7th at 2:15 pm.  Arrangements will be made by the Clerk to have Mr. Hogan appear by video for this hearing.  Attorney Frost makes a record that the Defendant was supposed to be bringing a document with him today that she intended to give to the State.  It has to do with a letter written by Mr. Osinski.  She will ask Mr. Hogan to mail the document to her.  2:37 pm  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost. Attorney Frost is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial.  There are a number of different issues that have come up:  1)  Disk of jail phone calls - 100's of phone calls to review;  2)  Missing a couple of items that prior counsel did not provide;  3)  Has been able to get one of the witnesses subpoenaed yet.  Atty Herrmann advises that the State would be ready to proceed but has no objection to a continuance.  The State is requesting that the sentencing after revocation hearing in case 2012CF000341 be scheduled at this time.  Atty Frost would prefer that it continue to track the defendant's pending case.  Court will grant request to reschedule the JT in this case and will also schedule the SEHR in the 2012 case.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 3-12-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**
State
Defense

3:32 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DDA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with Atty Melissa Anne Frost.  
Matter is before the Court on 2 motions filed by the defense; a Motion to Dismiss and a Motion asking Court to allow Denny evidence.  Court has reviewed the Motions and the State's response to the Motion to Dismiss; State will just make oral argument with regard to the Denny evidence.  Atty Frost would have Nakisha Tolon testify as to what she was told by her brother, Glen Tolon, as to who the drugs belonged to.  Atty Frost has no witnesses for her Motion to Dismiss.  Court will start with the Denny motion.  Atty Frost has made an offer of proof.  Court will accept the defense offer of proof.  3:34 pm  Argument by Attorney Frost with regard to the Denny motion.  3:36 pm  Response by Atty Herrmann.   3:38 pm  Further argument by Atty Frost.  3:40 pm  Court makes findings that there is a legitimate tendency that a third party could have committed this crime.  There is a direct connection to the crime.  There were 3 people in the car.  Court is not persuaded by the argument that more than one person could possess the drugs.  Defendant has not been charged as party to a crime.  Court grants Denny Motion.  
3:47 pm  Court next addresses Motion to Dismiss.  Court has reviewed the written positions of both sides.  
3:48 pm  Argument by Atty Frost.   
3:50 pm  Argument by Atty Herrmann.  
3:53 pm  Response by Atty Frost.  
3:54 pm  Response by Atty Herrmann.  
3:55 pm  Court makes findings and denies Motion to Dismiss.  There's been no showing of bad faith on behalf of the State or the police.  
4:02 pm  Court in recess.  


**TRANSCRIPT FILED 3-12-18: COURT REPORTER LINDA MATOSKA**

TRANSCRIPT FILED on March 12, 2018. Court Reporter Linda C. Matoska.
Attorney: Melissa Frost

11:04 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with Atty Mark S Rosen.   
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing after revocation hearing ON FILE 2012CF000341.    
Court makes record as to charge and maximum potential penalties.  Court has reviewed the file including the sentencnig after revocation summary provided by the Dept.  
Atty Herrmann makes record with regard to victim notification.  
Atty Rosen has reviewed the materials submitted by the Department.  He has no corrections to make to the information in the report.  
Atty Herrmann makes a record that Atty Rosen just now requested the police reports in this case.  Response by Atty Rosen that he did review the reports.  Court addresses defendant as to whether he wishes to proceed with the sentencing today.  
11:08 am  Court takes recess to allow Atty Rosen to discuss this further with Mr. Hogan.  
11:12 am  Court in session.  Response by Mr. Hogan to Court's questions.  Response by Atty Rosen.  Attorney Herrmann makes further record as to his concerns.  Atty Rosen makes a record that the Deft has advised Atty Rosen that he wants a new lawyer on his pending case but wants Atty Rosen to proceed as his Atty on his sentencing after revocation case.  Response by Defendant to Court's question.  Atty Rosen notes he has also filed a Writ of Certiorari which is scheduled in December of this year.  
Based upon statements of Mr. Hogan that he wants a new attorney appointed through the SPD office, the Court is not going to proceed on the sentencing after revocation today.  The Court will allow Atty Rosen to withdraw on both files 2016CF000028 and 2012CF000341.  Atty Rosen will immediately contact the SPD's office.  Defendant is currently serving a prison sentence in Dodge.  Defendant asks that he be held here in our jail until he's had a chance to speak with his new attorney.  Court can ask the Jail to hold him here but cannot guarantee that he will be able to stay.  Question by defendant with regard to discovery.  Atty Herrmann makes record with regard to notice that was given to Atty Rosen with regard to additional discovery.  Response by Atty Rosen as to discovery that he has received through his investigator.  Court schedules both files for a status conference next week.  
11:23 am  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Attorney Mark Rosen
Scheduling Order - copies were provided to Attorneys in Court on 10/13/2016

8:29 am  Court in session.  Case called. Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with attorney Mark S Rosen.  
Matter is before the Court to make an oral decision with regard to the Motions to Suppress filed by the defense.  
Atty Herrmann has no further argument
8:30 am  Argument by Atty Rosen.  
8:30 am  Court makes record.  The Court has reviewed the transcript that was prepared and the written submissions of the parties.  Court makes findings.  Court notes that there were multiple motions to suppress by the Defense - the first one is stating that there was not a reasonable and articulable reason for stopping the car in the first place (Terry Stop).  Court finds there was a reasonable and articulable suspicion for stopping the vehicle.  Court determines that the continued stop or holding of the defendant was further justified.  Under totality of circumstances, Court finds the State has met its burden or proof.  Court makes determination that search of vehicle was lawful.  Court denies Motion to Suppress.  
8:44 am  Atty Rosen makes record that the Defendant's extended supervision was revoked on another file and he also has a sentencing after revocation hearing scheduled before this Court on November 1st.   
Court schedules matter for FPT and Jury Trial.   Court will also have this case to track the Defendant's closed file 2012CF000341 which is currently scheduled for sentencing after revocation on November 1st at 11:00 a.m.  Atty Rosen to prepare Order from today's hearing.  Attorneys are provided with the copy of the Court's scheduling Order.  

Further proceedings scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.

8:49 am  Court in recess.
Notice of Self-Imposed Disqualification
State's Reply to Defendant's Response Brief
Defendant's Motion Hearing Brief
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for leave to appeal is denied without costs.

Transcript of Motion Hearing before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on September 6, 2016
Court Reporter Linda Matoska

9:59 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Deft Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with Atty Mark S Rosen.  
Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is on the calendar today for a couple of Motions.  
Court has reviewed the file and the materials that have been filed by both sides.  
Court will first address the Other Acts Evidence Motion.  
State is relying upon its motion / affidavit as an offer of proof and is not presenting any testimony.    
10:01 am  Argument by Atty Rosen.  
10:05 am  Response by Atty Herrmann.  
10:07 am  Response by Atty Rosen.  
10:08 am  Court makes findings.  It is being offered for a acceptable purposes (for plan or scheme; for identity; for 904.04(2) - absence of mistake or accident).  
2nd prong of Sullivan analysis - Court finds other acts evidence to be relevant.  
3rd prong of Sullivan Analysis - Court does not believe that the defense has shown that the probative value is substantially outweighed by the danger of unfair prejudice.  
Court grants State's Motion to introduce other acts evidence.  Court can give a cautionary Instruction to the Jury.  

Court next addresses the Motion to Suppress.  
10:22 am  Deputy Daniel Nichols is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
10:34 am  Cross exam by Atty Rosen.  
10:42 am  Redirect by Atty Herrmann.  
10:43 am  Recross by Atty Rosen.  
10:43 am  Witness excused.  

10:44 am  Deputy Jeremy Renz is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Herrmann.  
10:48 am  Cross exam by Atty Rosen.  
10:49 am  Witness excused.  
10:49 am  Record is closed.  Court will grant Atty Rosen time to respond to State's Brief which it just received this morning.  He would like to also request a transcript of today's hearing.  
Court schedules further hearing for ruling on this motion.  Atty Rosen to file his Brief in response to State's brief by September 29th.  State will then have until October 6th to file a reply.  
The defendant's probation was recently revoked and the defendant will be serving the imposed and stayed prison sentence.  Parties are to notify Court's clerk if a Writ will be needed to produce the defendant for the next hearing.  Oral Ruling:  October 13, 2016 at 8:30 am (30 minutes reserved)

10:42 am  Court in recess.  

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 9-9-2016: Court Reporter Linda Matoska**
State's Brief in response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Stop

Transcript of Motion Hearing before the Hon. David M. Reddy on July 1, 2016
Court Reporter:  Sandra Elderbrook
Acknowledge of Filing of Writ/ Petition (Petition for Leave to Appeal)
Order Denying Motion to Dismiss

9:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.   
Atty Andrew R Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Raymond E. Hogan in court, in custody with Atty Mark S Rosen.  
Matter is before the Court on a couple of different matters:    
Deft's Motion to Dismiss because of lack of probable cause.  State's Other Acts Evidence and a previously filed Motion to Suppress filed by Atty Flitcroft.  
Atty Rosen has a copy of Mr. Flitcroft's Motion.  The State however never received a copy of the Motion to Suppress filed by Atty Flitcroft.  Since the State was not aware of this Motion, no witnesses have been subpoened and the State cannot go forward with that Motion today.  Atty Rosen indicates that the last time that he was in court, he advised DA Necci that he needed the police reports for the other acts motion.  DA Necci never provided him with those reports.  Atty Herrmann states that the notes in their file indicate that Atty Rosen could check out the police reports.  The DA's file was available to be checked out.  Court is going to write it off as a misunderstanding between DA Necci and Atty Rosen.  Atty Rosen states he was told by DA Necci that he would mail them.  
9:06 am  Court deals with Motion to Dismiss.  Court makes record and denies the Motion for being untimely.  Response by Atty Rosen that Atty Flitcroft indicated it took quite a while to get the transcript from the preliminary hearing.  He didn't get the transcript until 45 days later.  He would not have an issue for arguing the motion without first having and reviewing the transcript of the preliminary hearing.  Court does not believe the issue was properly preserved by Atty Flitcroft.  Court's decision stands.  Court reschedules the Motion to Suppress and the Other Acts Evidence Motion to September 6, 2016 at 10:00 a.m. (2 hours).  9:12 am  Court in recess.

Notice of Arrest

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH 108 S. CHURCH ST.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
